page.title: 05Temple Cloud+Knights Templar
page.content: The growth of Temple Cloud was stimulated by the turnpiking of the Bristol Road in the mid-18th century. But its name suggests a more romantic cause for its original development. Locally two stories are told about its foundation.It is suggested that the village was the site of a Roman temple.Alternatively 'Temple' refers to the Knights Templar while 'Cloud' means 'hill' or 'quarry'.Writing in the 'Bristol Evening World' of Sept. 20 1952 Gray Usher,a Local Historian, described an outbuilding at Manor Farm,Temple Cloud,as being a Commandry of Knights Templar. The story about a Roman Temple has been largely discredited,but an association with the excommunicated Knights Templar remains an intriguing possibility.
